exercises.name: Wall Push-up
exercises.description: Push-up performed standing against a wall
instructions: 1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length
2. Place palms flat against the wall at shoulder height and width
3. Bend elbows to bring chest toward the wall
4. Push back to starting position
5. Maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout
exercises.tips: Keep core engaged and maintain a straight body position. Move feet further from wall to increase difficulty.

exercises.name: Knee Push-up
exercises.description: Push-up performed with knees on the ground
instructions: 1. Start in a modified plank position with knees on the ground
2. Place hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart
3. Lower chest toward the ground by bending elbows
4. Push back up to starting position
5. Maintain a straight line from head to knees throughout
exercises.tips: Keep elbows at a 45-degree angle from your body, not flared out to the sides. Focus on full range of motion.

exercises.name: Push-up
exercises.description: Standard push-up with full body weight on toes and hands
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
2. Keep body in a straight line from head to heels
3. Lower chest toward the ground by bending elbows
4. Push back up to starting position
5. Maintain core engagement throughout
exercises.tips: Keep neck neutral by looking slightly ahead of your hands, not at the floor directly below. Engage glutes to maintain proper alignment.

exercises.name: Diamond Push-up
exercises.description: Push-up with hands close together forming a diamond shape
instructions: 1. Start in a plank position
2. Place hands close together with thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond shape
3. Lower chest toward your hands by bending elbows
4. Push back up to starting position
5. Keep elbows close to body throughout movement
exercises.tips: This variation places greater emphasis on the triceps. Keep core tight to prevent sagging hips.

exercises.name: Archer Push-up
exercises.description: Push-up with one arm extended sideways while the other performs the movement
instructions: 1. Start in a push-up position with hands wider than normal
2. As you lower your body, bend one arm while extending the other arm straight out to the side
3. Push back up through the bent arm
4. Alternate sides with each repetition
5. Keep body in a straight line throughout
exercises.tips: This is a unilateral exercise that builds strength toward one-arm push-ups. Ensure the straight arm remains fully extended.

exercises.name: Chest Press Machine
exercises.description: Pushing movement on a fixed-path lever machine
instructions: 1. Adjust seat height so handles align with mid-chest
2. Grasp handles with a full grip
3. Push handles forward until arms are extended (not locked)
4. Slowly return to starting position with control
5. Maintain back contact with the pad throughout
exercises.tips: Focus on pushing through the chest muscles, not just the arms. Avoid arching your back during the movement.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
exercises.description: Pressing dumbbells upward while lying on a bench
instructions: 1. Lie on a flat bench holding dumbbells at chest level
2. Position dumbbells at the sides of your chest with palms facing forward
3. Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended (not locked)
4. Lower weights with control back to starting position
5. Maintain feet flat on floor and natural arch in lower back
exercises.tips: Dumbbells allow for a greater range of motion than barbell. Lower the weights until you feel a stretch in your chest.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.description: Pressing a barbell upward while lying on a bench
instructions: 1. Lie on a flat bench with feet flat on the floor
2. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width
3. Unrack the bar and lower it to mid-chest level
4. Press the bar upward until arms are extended (not locked)
5. Control the bar back to the starting position
exercises.tips: Keep wrists straight and elbows at approximately 45-degree angles from your body. Use a spotter when lifting heavy.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
exercises.description: Pressing dumbbells upward on an inclined bench
instructions: 1. Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
2. Sit with back against the bench, dumbbells at shoulder level
3. Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended (not locked)
4. Lower weights with control back to starting position
5. Maintain feet flat on floor and back against bench
exercises.tips: The incline shifts emphasis to the upper chest and front deltoids. Maintain control throughout the movement.

exercises.name: Weighted Push-up
exercises.description: Standard push-up with added weight on the back
instructions: 1. Have a training partner place a weight plate on your upper back
2. Assume standard push-up position
3. Lower chest toward the ground by bending elbows
4. Push back up to starting position
5. Maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout
exercises.tips: Start with lighter weights and progress gradually. A weight vest can be used as an alternative to plates.

exercises.name: Pike Push-up
exercises.description: Push-up with elevated hips creating an inverted V-shape
instructions: 1. Start in a downward dog position with hips raised high
2. Place hands shoulder-width apart
3. Bend elbows to lower head toward the floor
4. Push back up to starting position
5. Keep hips elevated throughout the movement
exercises.tips: The higher your hips, the more shoulder engagement. This exercise helps build toward handstand push-ups.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
exercises.description: Pressing dumbbells overhead from shoulder level
instructions: 1. Sit or stand with dumbbells at shoulder level, palms facing forward
2. Press dumbbells overhead until arms are extended (not locked)
3. Lower weights with control back to shoulder level
4. Keep core engaged and avoid arching lower back
5. Repeat for desired repetitions
exercises.tips: If standing, maintain a slight bend in the knees and keep core tight. Avoid using momentum to lift the weights.

exercises.name: Barbell Shoulder Press
exercises.description: Pressing a barbell overhead from shoulder level
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
2. Hold barbell at shoulder level with hands slightly wider than shoulders
3. Press barbell overhead until arms are extended (not locked)
4. Lower bar with control back to shoulder level
5. Keep core engaged and maintain neutral spine
exercises.tips: Avoid leaning back to push the weight up. If mobility is limited, try seated variation or use a rack.

exercises.name: Arnold Press
exercises.description: Dynamic shoulder press with rotation during the movement
instructions: 1. Sit or stand with dumbbells at shoulder level, palms facing you
2. As you press up, rotate wrists so palms face forward at the top
3. Extend arms fully overhead (not locked)
4. Lower weights while rotating wrists back to starting position
5. Keep core engaged throughout movement
exercises.tips: The rotation increases deltoid activation. Start with lighter weights to master the technique.

exercises.name: Lateral Raise
exercises.description: Raising dumbbells out to sides to target lateral deltoids
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at sides
2. Slightly bend elbows and maintain this bend throughout
3. Raise arms out to sides until hands reach shoulder height
4. Briefly pause at the top
5. Lower weights with control to starting position
exercises.tips: Use lighter weights and focus on proper form. Avoid using momentum to swing the weights up.

exercises.name: Door Row
exercises.description: Pulling exercise using a door, Smith machine, or TRX
instructions: 1. Set up TRX straps or position yourself at Smith machine bar
2. Grip the handles/bar and lean back with arms extended
3. Keep body straight from head to heels
4. Pull chest toward the handles/bar by bending elbows
5. Return to starting position with control
exercises.tips: The more horizontal your body, the more challenging the exercise. Keep core engaged throughout.

exercises.name: Inverted Row
exercises.description: Horizontal pulling exercise with body suspended under a bar
instructions: 1. Position bar at waist to chest height
2. Hang underneath with arms extended and heels on floor
3. Keep body straight from head to heels
4. Pull chest up to the bar
5. Lower with control to starting position
exercises.tips: Elevating feet makes the exercise harder. Bending knees makes it easier. Squeeze shoulder blades together at the top.

exercises.name: Chin-up
exercises.description: Vertical pulling exercise with palms facing toward you
instructions: 1. Hang from bar with palms facing toward you (supinated grip)
2. Arms fully extended, shoulders engaged
3. Pull body up until chin clears the bar
4. Lower with control to starting position
5. Avoid swinging or kicking for momentum
exercises.tips: Supinated grip engages biceps more than pronated grip. Keep core tight and avoid excessive arching.

exercises.name: Pull-up
exercises.description: Vertical pulling exercise with palms facing away from you
instructions: 1. Hang from bar with palms facing away from you (pronated grip)
2. Arms fully extended, shoulders engaged
3. Pull body up until chin clears the bar
4. Lower with control to starting position
5. Maintain controlled movement throughout
exercises.tips: Pronated grip places more emphasis on the lats. Focus on pulling with your back, not just your arms.

exercises.name: Archer Pull-up
exercises.description: Unilateral pull-up with one arm extended sideways
instructions: 1. Hang from bar with hands wider than shoulder-width
2. Pull up while shifting body weight to one side
3. Extend the opposite arm sideways as you pull up
4. Lower with control to starting position
5. Alternate sides with each repetition
exercises.tips: This variation builds strength toward one-arm pull-ups. Ensure the working arm pulls with maximum effort.

exercises.name: Lat Pulldown
exercises.description: Machine exercise pulling a bar down to chest level
instructions: 1. Sit at lat pulldown machine with thighs secured under pads
2. Grip the bar with hands wider than shoulder-width
3. Pull the bar down to upper chest level
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together at bottom position
5. Return bar with control to starting position
exercises.tips: Keep chest up and avoid leaning back excessively. Focus on pulling with your back muscles, not just arms.

exercises.name: Seated Row
exercises.description: Machine exercise pulling a handle toward abdomen
instructions: 1. Sit at row machine with feet on platforms
2. Grasp handles with arms extended
3. Pull handles toward lower abdomen
4. Squeeze shoulder blades together at contracted position
5. Return to starting position with control
exercises.tips: Maintain upright posture, avoid rounding shoulders. Pull handles to your torso, not your torso to the handles.

exercises.name: Assisted Pull-up
exercises.description: Pull-up with machine assistance to reduce bodyweight
instructions: 1. Adjust weight on assisted pull-up machine
2. Place knees or feet on platform
3. Grip bar with hands wider than shoulder-width
4. Pull up until chin clears the bar
5. Lower with control to starting position
exercises.tips: Gradually reduce assistance as strength improves. Focus on proper form rather than rushing repetitions.

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-up
exercises.description: Pull-up with additional weight attached
instructions: 1. Attach weight belt with plate or hold dumbbell between feet
2. Grip pull-up bar with hands wider than shoulder-width
3. Pull up until chin clears the bar
4. Lower with control to starting position
5. Maintain proper form throughout
exercises.tips: Start with lighter weights and progress gradually. Ensure weight is secure before beginning the exercise.

exercises.name: One-arm Pull-up
exercises.description: Pull-up performed using a single arm
instructions: 1. Grip pull-up bar with one hand
2. Keep other arm at side or hold wrist of working arm
3. Pull up until chin clears the bar
4. Lower with control to starting position
5. Complete all reps on one side before switching
exercises.tips: This is an extremely 4 movement. Use archer pull-ups and assisted one-arm variations to build up to this.

exercises.name: Box Squat
exercises.description: Squat performed to a box or bench
instructions: 1. Stand in front of a bench with feet shoulder-width apart
2. Bend knees and hips to lower toward the bench
3. Lightly touch the bench with your glutes (don't fully sit)
4. Drive through heels to stand back up
5. Keep chest up throughout movement
exercises.tips: The box provides a depth target and builds confidence. Focus on control rather than speed.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squat
exercises.description: Basic squat using only bodyweight resistance
instructions: 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
2. Bend knees and hips to lower into squat position
3. Lower until thighs are at least parallel to floor
4. Drive through heels to return to standing
5. Keep chest up and back straight throughout
exercises.tips: Keep weight in heels and mid-foot, not toes. Aim to get thighs parallel to the ground or lower if mobility allows.

exercises.name: Split Squat
exercises.description: Single-leg focused squat with staggered stance
instructions: 1. Take a long step forward into a staggered stance
2. Keep torso upright, core engaged
3. Bend both knees to lower your body
4. Front thigh should reach parallel to floor
5. Push through front heel to return to starting position
exercises.tips: Keep front knee aligned with foot, not caving inward. Both feet remain in contact with the floor throughout.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat
exercises.description: Single-leg squat with rear foot elevated
instructions: 1. Stand about 2 feet in front of a bench
2. Place top of rear foot on the bench behind you
3. Lower by bending front knee until thigh is parallel to floor
4. Keep torso upright, front knee aligned with foot
5. Push through front heel to return to starting position
exercises.tips: Focus on balance and control. Can be progressed by holding dumbbells for added resistance.

exercises.name: Pistol Squat
exercises.description: Single-leg squat with other leg extended forward
instructions: 1. Stand on one leg, extend the other leg forward
2. Extend arms forward for counterbalance
3. Bend supporting knee to lower toward the floor
4. Keep extended leg off the floor throughout
5. Push through heel to return to standing position
exercises.tips: This requires significant strength, balance, and mobility. Practice with assistance (holding a post or TRX) before attempting freestanding.

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.description: Pushing a weighted platform with legs while seated
instructions: 1. Sit on leg press machine with back against pad
2. Place feet shoulder-width apart on platform
3. Release safety catches and lower platform by bending knees
4. Lower until knees form 90-degree angles
5. Push through heels to extend legs (don't lock knees)
exercises.tips: Avoid placing hands on knees during the movement. Don't lock out knees at the top of the movement.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat
exercises.description: Squat while holding dumbbell or kettlebell at chest
instructions: 1. Hold dumbbell vertically against chest with both hands
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
3. Bend knees and hips to lower into squat position
4. Keep chest up, elbows inside knees
5. Push through heels to return to standing
exercises.tips: The weight acts as a counterbalance, helping maintain proper form. Focus on depth and upright posture.

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat
exercises.description: Squat with barbell across upper back/shoulders
instructions: 1. Position barbell across upper back (not neck)
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
3. Bend knees and hips to lower into squat position
4. Lower until thighs are parallel to floor or below
5. Drive through heels to return to standing
exercises.tips: Keep chest up and core braced. Knees should track in line with toes. Use a squat rack for safety.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
exercises.description: Hip-hinge movement with minimal knee bend
instructions: 1. Hold barbell at hip level with overhand grip
2. Stand with feet hip-width apart
3. Hinge at hips to lower bar along legs
4. Keep back flat, slight bend in knees
5. Lower until feeling stretch in hamstrings, then return to standing
exercises.tips: This is a hip hinge, not a squat. Focus on pushing hips back rather than bending knees. Keep bar close to legs throughout.

exercises.name: Barbell Front Squat
exercises.description: Squat with barbell held at front of shoulders
instructions: 1. Position barbell across front of shoulders
2. Cross arms to secure bar or use clean grip
3. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
4. Bend knees and hips to lower into squat position
5. Keep elbows high, torso upright throughout movement
exercises.tips: Front position requires more core strength and upper back stability. Focus on keeping elbows high to prevent bar from rolling forward.

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.description: Core stability exercise with opposing limb movement
instructions: 1. Lie on back with arms extended toward ceiling
2. Bring knees up to 90-degree angle
3. Extend one arm behind head while extending opposite leg
4. Return to starting position
5. Repeat with opposite arm and leg
exercises.tips: Keep lower back pressed into the floor throughout. Move slowly with control, focusing on stability.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: Isometric core exercise in push-up position
instructions: 1. Start in forearm plank position, elbows under shoulders
2. Engage core and glutes to maintain straight line from head to heels
3. Keep neck neutral, looking at floor
4. Hold position for prescribed time
5. Avoid sagging hips or raising buttocks
exercises.tips: Quality over quantity - focus on proper form. Breathe normally throughout the hold.

exercises.name: Hanging Knee Raise
exercises.description: Raising bent knees toward chest while hanging
instructions: 1. Hang from pull-up bar with arms fully extended
2. Engage core and avoid swinging
3. Bend knees and raise them toward chest
4. Hold briefly at top position
5. Lower legs with control to starting position
exercises.tips: Focus on using abs to lift knees, not hip flexors. Avoid swinging or using momentum.

exercises.name: Hanging Leg Raise
exercises.description: Raising straight legs while hanging
instructions: 1. Hang from pull-up bar with arms fully extended
2. Keep legs straight and together
3. Engage core to raise legs to parallel with floor or higher
4. Hold briefly at top position
5. Lower legs with control to starting position
exercises.tips: Maintain tension in the abs throughout the movement. Avoid swinging or using momentum.

exercises.name: Toes-to-bar
exercises.description: Raising straight legs to touch bar while hanging
instructions: 1. Hang from pull-up bar with arms fully extended
2. Initiate movement by engaging core and pulling shoulder blades down
3. Raise legs in arc motion until toes touch the bar
4. Control the descent back to starting position
5. Maintain tension throughout movement
exercises.tips: This requires significant core strength, grip endurance, and flexibility. Focus on controlled movement rather than momentum.

exercises.name: Cable Crunch
exercises.description: Kneeling crunch with cable resistance
instructions: 1. Kneel facing cable machine with rope attachment
2. Hold rope behind head with both hands
3. Contract abs to curl torso down toward knees
4. Hold contracted position briefly
5. Return to starting position with control
exercises.tips: Focus on curling the torso down using the abs, not pulling with the arms. Keep hips stationary throughout.

exercises.name: Roman Chair Sit-up
exercises.description: Sit-up performed on specialized bench with feet anchored
instructions: 1. Position yourself on Roman chair with feet secured
2. Cross arms over chest or place hands by ears
3. Lower torso back toward floor with control
4. Raise torso back up to starting position
5. Maintain controlled movement throughout
exercises.tips: Adjust the bench angle to modify difficulty. Focus on using abs to lift, not hip flexors or momentum.

exercises.name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist
exercises.description: Seated rotation exercise with medicine ball
instructions: 1. Sit on floor with knees bent, feet elevated slightly
2. Hold medicine ball with both hands at chest level
3. Lean back slightly to engage core
4. Rotate torso to touch ball to floor on one side
5. Rotate to opposite side in controlled motion
exercises.tips: The further you lean back, the more challenging it becomes. Focus on rotating from the core, not just moving the arms.

exercises.name: Ab Wheel Rollout
exercises.description: Rolling wheel device forward while maintaining core stability
instructions: 1. Kneel on floor with ab wheel in front of knees
2. Grasp handles with both hands
3. Roll wheel forward while extending body
4. Extend as far as possible while maintaining flat back
5. Use core strength to pull wheel back to starting position
exercises.tips: Start with small ranges of motion and gradually increase as strength improves. Keep core engaged throughout to protect lower back.

exercises.name: Weighted Plank
exercises.description: Standard plank with added weight on back
instructions: 1. Have a training partner place weight plate on middle of back
2. Assume forearm plank position, elbows under shoulders
3. Maintain straight line from head to heels
4. Engage core and glutes throughout hold
5. Hold position for prescribed time
exercises.tips: Start with lighter weights and progress gradually. Ensure weight is centered and stable before beginning the hold.
